text: Enjoyed at a tasting at Toms last night. 500 mL bottle. This baby slowly filled the bottle, and then overflowed. Constantly, until half of the bottle was poured, then the head receded in the bottle. The pour is a cloudy golden yellow with a large off white head that falls down slowly with a hefty lace left behind. The aroma is strange. There is a fair bit of fruitiness here, but I dont know if thats just from the wine barrel that was used. Its just faint. The There is a light tropical fruit and a heavy funkiness. Its also got a light woodiness thats throwing me off. The flavor is strong funk, light oak, and a hint of tropical fruits and blueberry. Its definitely more prevalent than the nose. The mouth feel is light and clean with a softer carbonation and a lingeringly funky and dry finish. I think this one needed to be fresh.
UPDATED: SEP 9, 2016 brett significant with some woodiness from 2011 to round out the sourness. low acid. Blueberry on the aftertaste, interacting well with brett.

Stillbow Oxtisanal, 6.5%
Bottle, courtesy of the Oxbow owner, Tom Adams (?), thanks a lot mate!. Its an unclear, orange colored beer with a dense, small, off-white to light beige colored head. The aroma has a lovely barrel touch, funky orange notes, hints of berries, a hint of lemon and leather, some pale malts and a generic fruity sweetness. Its not sweet on the palate though, its quite dry actually and lightly tart, with a high but nice level of carbonation and a medium to full body. Theres a good dash of fresh orange in the flavor, a vague hint of blueberry and citrus peel, some grass and pale malts and also some tannins. Some lemon and a faint leathery, barnyardish touch as well. Lasting finish with orange and a touch of blueberries and barrel and funk. A really lovely beer, proving that a blend of orange and blueberry can be very nice, and with all the other flavors and aromas added it sure ends up as a wonderful beer. Easy drinkable, tasteful and refreshing. 150613

Bottle 500ml @ Motel room, Crystal Inn, Niagara Falls, ON
Pours hazy deep golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, yeast, brett, funk, pineapple, mango and some fruits. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long funky, fruity, brett and yeasty finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle thanks to bursprak. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of blueberry, mandarin, lemon zest and overall citrusy and juicy. Behind this there are some funky and more bretty notes. The taste is extremely funky with notes of grapefruit, dry wood, herbal notes, citrus fruits and weak cheese. Has a weak saison feeling to it. Barrel character is pretty subtle.

Bottle split 4 ways, thanks bytemesis! Cloudy golden pour with a fluffy head. Nose has sweet blueberries, grapefruit, funky, some estery notes and citrus peel. Taste has some light blueberries, dusty, floral notes, grapefruit, citric, lemon zest and some solid funk.

Bottle thanks to Bursprak! Pours hazy light orange with a big white fluffy head. 

Aromas of citrus, lemon zest, mandarin, tart blueberries, funk, hay, floral notes, brett, dust. 

Taste is sweet, funky, sparkly, citrus, acid, grapefruit, some blueberries, lots of juicy fruit stuff going on! Lemon, vanilla, brett, dirt, dust, hay.

Bottle 50cl thanks to Bursprak! Pours a hazy golden yellow with a big, white, soapy head. Aroma has grape fruit, oak, tart blueberries, yeasty funk, brett, dirty, dusty hay and barn. Mandarin juice, citrus peel. Taste is very sparkling, citrussy fruity, funky, pretty acidic. Lots of grape fruit! Fairly high fruity bitterness as well. Blueberries are more present in the aroma. Oaky dry finish, but very juicy over all. Body is extremely sparkling and crisp. Gotta say that the barrel character is pretty subtle.
Really quite nice. Evident Brett with slight barrel character and fruit. Really interesting barrel idea.

Bottle... Pours hazy and straw-colored with a small, creamy, white head. The nose delivers notes of funky old cheese, fallen oak, lemon and sourdough. Light to medium-bodied with vibrant carbonation. Tart and bitter - apricot and citric acidity up front; tangy-sweet plum and a modest measure of crusty bitterness on the backside. Lengthy, tongue-numbing finale.

Bottle - thanks jbportland! Just a bit of a gusher on opening. Pours hazy golden yellow with a large white head that dissipates slowly leaving solid lacing. Aroma is really vinous, oaky, lots of Bretty funk. Flavor follows, dry with light plus tartness, lots of Brett, and the good kind. Medium light body, high carbonation. Excellent.

50cl, new exclusive American collab. brew Anno 2013, with blueberries, thx alot to Vincent for bringing this over!, very complex brew, woody/fruity and slightly sour/spicy/vinous, balanced, cloudy, small head, very good brew, yet very expensive!

At Eurhop festival in Rome-Italy. Little quantity from a bottle shared among the customers. Courtesy of the brewer himself. Pours yellow cloudy with a great white foam. Nose is acidic, vinegar, farmhouse yeast. Mouth: round saison with the right acidic feel which makes it a balanced and unique saison. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared at a tasting. Clear gold pour with thin white head. Aroma is juicy, really hoppy, fruity with lots of white wine. Taste is winey, flour-y notes, really bready, citrusy hoppiness, mild farmy charcter, tart finish. Palate is light and dry, super easy drinking. Tasty stuff.

Bottle (500 ml). Thanks to Matt for this one! Cloudy yellow/golden with a small persistent white head and little lacing. Aroma is of nice brettanomyces, hay, nice fruitiness, vanilla notes, oak and light berries. Taste is really nice too with brettanomyces, vanilla notes, lemon, berries, hay and oak. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Dry finish. Super tasty and quite drinkable.

Thanks Matt for bringing this to Tommy to share. enjoyed 4 ways in stemware.

A - Nose has a minor hazy orange and a 2 finger creamy head that fades fast to next to nothing.

S - Has a mild acidic and tart lemon skin bitterness like european hops and some solid wheat and tropical fruit.

T - Taste has a very clean lively fruity bitterness. I get mango and papaya with peach toward the end. Great clean tart notes, some wine barrel notes, clean grape skin.

M - Very dry with a light sweetness.

O - Great beer. deserves the current rating. Love this beer.

500 ml bottle from Lukaduke shared with the group. Pours a hazy golden color with a medium sized white head. The aroma and flavor have tart fruit, oak, Brett, funk, dry, very easy to drink, I liked this and would recommend this to others.

UPDATED: MAR 20, 2016 500 ml bottle to taster (shared by alexsdad06). Looks good; a gusher though. A cloudy apricot with white head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells good; bretty and oaky with a mild vinous presence. Tastes like it smells with a medium-bodied, fairly dry mouthfeel. Good beer.
Bottle. Hazy pale yellow color, fluffy head with good retention and lacing. Beautiful aroma of vanilla, subtle licorice, barns. Taste is light attic and dust. Delicious.

Hazy golden color with a small, white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of blueberries, oak, citrus, light spices, and toasted malts. Taste of citrus, sweeter blueberries, vanilla oak, some tartness, acidic, dry finish.

100th saison! 500 ml bottle poured into a tulip glass thanks to lukaduke. Pours a hazy yellow with a big white head of foam with great retention. The aroma is musty peach and pineapple. Smells great! The taste has just a tingle of tartness as well as a dry white wine similarity. Medium body. Effervescent. Medium to high carbonation. Refreshing.

50cl bottle pours a hazy gold with some tight, white head. Nose is really nice, a little musty, a bit doughy too, a little bit of hay, some lemon, a bit of white grape. Flavor has some sweet apple and pear, a little lemon bitterness, mild funk, some cheese rind, some hay. Mostly clean finish. Interesting.

hazy gold, thin white ring, lightly oily. Very soft lemon, dusty dough with spritely carbonation, very balanced. Bit thin on front, earthy and wheaty with tons of soft dough and lemon, lightly peppery wheat dominance through soft finish. No detectable fruit and in definite need of more acidity.
Some coriander, some bretta. Pours cloudy orange with good head and lacing, though I got the bottom of the bottle. Nice orange smell. Soft carbonation. Bottle thanks to MrChopin at Epic Sour Tasting.

From a bottle shared at the DC Epic Sour Beer Tasting. Thanks MrChopin! Pours a hazy gold with an off white head. Aroma of tart apples with some latex notes. Flavors of grapes and white pepper. Soft tart finish.
Bottle. Poured a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Aroma was notes of sweet malt, light fruits, yeast character. Flavor was funky light notes. Tasty.

Back rate. Pours a copper color with foamy white head. Aroma is heavy brett, oak, light lactic tartness, berrys, and vinous notes. Taste is nicely fruity with a dry funky brett backbone and a tart kick.. Great.
Gold pour, white head. So this is saison meets sour. Tart and fruity with a great sour backbone. Blueberry skins, yeast, light peppery notes. Badass.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks Ariel. Pours yellow, hazy with a nice head, aroma of brett, freshness, green tea, pleasant, flavor of brett, green tea, leafs, sulfur, some fruits and urine touch, medium to full bodied, excellent
Hazy golden pour with soft white head. Aroma of tart citrus and yeast. Flavor has plenty of brett, citrus peel, yeast, and spice.
bottle at Of Love & Regret, Baltimore. wonderful beer. blode with purple hues. Funky brett, light oak, blueberry, touches of white wine. tart, fruity, dry finish, awesome

500 ml bottle. Hazy orange with white froth. Nose is flowers, yeast, suede and grass. Crisp and creamy with a tongue tickling tingle like a dry champagne. Taste is bitter lemon, vanilla yoghurt and earth. The faint sweetness of the blueberry wine blends beautifully into the lime pith of the brett.

Bouteille de 500 ml partagée lors dune dégustation Ratebeer Montréal. Arôme: Odeur de brett avec une pointe dagrume. Apparence: La couleur est blonde opaque. Présence dun mine col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de céréale avec une pointe dagrume et de fruité.. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût fruité. (Rating #5429)

Pale slightly orangey yellow with a small pale head. Aroma is peach, brett, coriander, apricot, hint of oak and wildflowers. Slightly creamy mouthfeel, sweet and sour on the palate, nice long finish. Taste is peach, lemongrass, honey, brett, white wine (Semillon).

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks Ariel. Cloudy yellow with a white head. Lovely funky aroma with barnyard, big fruitiness, a bit of sweaty notes, oak and vinous notes. Sourish and slightly sweetish flavor, very fruity, bretty, oaky, with a dry astringent finish. Medium-bodied. Great stuff.

Bottle courtesy of Lukaduke, looking nice in my Oxbow glass also courtesy of Lukaduke. Another winner from these guys, combining forces for this lovely tart saison with blueberry notes. Lively and bright. Want more!
Bottle at Torst. Pours cloudy gold with white head. Nose and taste of blueberry, oak, lemongrass, white wine and light funk. Medium body.

My Bottom Line:
Citrusy fruitiness with fieldberry angles add disctinction to this tart and fluffy Barrel-Aged Saison.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A slice of foam covers the cloudy hay blond.
-The blueberry wine touch morphs into white grape fruitiness quite quickly.
-A touch of green wood peers through in the second half.
-This is very drinkable and the level of rusticity is clear but polite.
-The barrel character does not take over here, which is highly appreciated. Nice dosage which creates uniqueness.

Bottle.
Thanks spike. Wow this is good. Hazy yellow with thin layer of head. Bretty saison yeasty deliciousness
Thanks to lukeaduke, great bretty flavor, light blueberrys pretty awesome shit, thanks bro

Hazy yellow pour with a white head. The aroma has some wheat, lemon and oak notes. The flavor is similar, with some nice woody character as well as some lemons, light berries and biscuit malt. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

(500ml bottle) clear gold, bright white bubbles. Nose of herbs, spices, field greens, lemon, lemongrass, white wine. Taste of oak, lemon, white pepper, sawdust, field greens, odd mix of flavors but complex.

Translucent, nearly opaque golden color. Soapy lace. So Bretty, hay, grass, pears in the nose. Taste doesn't quite click, unfortunately, with yeast in the lead squashing everything else in its path. Tastes like it wants to be a barrel-aged HF saison but falls quite far short.

Bottle @ home, courtesy of Lukaduke. Pours a hazy orange appearance with an off white head. Super funk pineapple, mango, bubblegum, super juicy aroma. Very spritzy, mango, peach, apricot, pineapple, bretty/tart funky flavor. FUCK YEAH.

Pour out of 500 mL bottle, hazy orange-yellow pour with white head, aroma brought big notes of oak, vanilla, nice lemon, hints of bretty notes as well as some peach, apricot, slight pear, this is nice. Taste is a mix of big bretty notes, big lemon, peach, apricot, hints of oak, slight grass, finishing oaky, slightly bretty, slightly tart. Very, very tasty.

500ml poured into proper glassware. Another gusher! Only lost an ounce or so. Bright yellow golden pour with a small fizzy head. Smells of apple, grapes, oak, and brett. Taste is slight brett funk, tart apples, oak. Great carbonation and super clean, dry finish. Awesome beer.

From 10/8 notes. 500ml bottle pours semi-hazy bright yellow with big 2 finger head. Nose is slightly tart citrus funk, oak, hay, barnyard, apple notes. Mouthfeel is very carbonated at first, champagne-like bubble stream is present in the glass. Taste is woody earthy oak, funky, brett, wheat, light tart, apple, pear. Finish is apple, faint blueberry notes, some barrel. Super refreshing, delicious saison.

Pours a slightly hazy medium golden color with a two finger thick fizzy white foam. The nose is bright complex and inviting with notes of dusty lemon, pineapple, wet oak, funky barnyard, light touches of hay and rustic grain and some hints of riesling and blueberry sweetness. On the palate it follows suit with some nice barrel character balancing nicely of the round yet refreshing body. Nice rustic backbone with a quenching tartness that is dialed in and plays nicely with the hints of vinous blueberry and lemony funk ! Pretty damn delicious...
